area.name: Canary Wharf
area.overview:
"The London Borough of Tower Hamlets is situated in the east of London. It covers much of the traditional East End.

Tower Hamlets includes one of the highest ethnic minority populations in the capital and has an established British Bangladeshis business and residential community. It is home to Brick Lane, a street renowned for its many curry houses.

A part of the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park is in Tower Hamlets."
area.stats:
"920
NEW HOMES
built in Tower Hamlets between April 2014 and March 2015

288k
TOTAL POPULATION
in 2015

15030
BUSINESSES
active in Tower Hamlets in 2013

240m
PASSENGERS
at Tower Hamlet's railway stations between April 2013 and March 2014"

area.name: City
area.overview:
"The City of London is the business district right at the centre of London. It’s often referred to as the Square Mile.

The City of London Corporation provides local authority services for the area. It also supports and promotes London as the world’s leading international financial and business centre.

The City works in partnership with local communities to increase skills, employment and opportunities, enhancing the city’s culture, history and green spaces for all Londoners.

It is headed by the Lord Mayor, an international ambassador for the City and UK financial and business services, a role separate from (and much older than) the Mayor of London."
area.stats:
"230
NEW HOMES
built in the City of London between April 2014 and March 2015

8200
TOTAL POPULATION
in 2015

17775
BUSINESSES
active in the City of London in 2013
392m
PASSENGERS
at the City of London's railway stations between April 2013 and 2014"

area.name: City
area.overview:
"Islington is one of the most vibrant parts of London. The borough has a thriving economy, a diverse population and a unique cultural identity.

It has more restaurants than days of the year, as well as many pubs, theatres, museums, cinemas and galleries. It's home to iconic Upper Street shopping, Arsenal Football Club, dance house Sadler's Wells and two London universities.

Historical areas such as Clerkenwell and Barnsbury reflect the borough’s past, while Silicon Roundabout is at the forefront of the UK’s new technology and creative industries. Its Georgian terraces and post-war housing estates regularly appear on TV and in films."
area.stats:
"500
NEW HOMES
built in Islington between April 2014 and March 2015

225k

in 2015

16850
BUSINESSES
active in Islington in 2013

177m
PASSENGERS
at Islington's railway stations between April 2013 and March 2014"

area.name: City
area.overview:
"Camden is home to street markets, world-famous music venues, museums, theatres, London Zoo and 681 acres of Hampstead Heath. It is a hugely diverse area of inner London, reaching from Covent Garden, to Euston and King’s Cross, to Hampstead and Highgate. Camden has 36 designated Conservation Areas, over 5,600 listed buildings and the seventh largest economy in the UK.

Camden Town has been a residential area since the 1790s, but it was the development of the Grand Union Canal and the improved railways that turned it into a bustling part of London. There are 162 English Heritage blue plaques, representing the many diverse personalities that have lived there. "
area.stats:
"440
NEW HOMES
built in Camden between April 2014 and March 2015

238k
TOTAL POPULATION
in 2015

27530
BUSINESSES
active in Camden in 2013

430m
PASSENGERS
at Camden's railway stations between April 2013 and March 2014"

area.name: City
area.overview:
"The London Borough of Southwark is in south London. It was formed in 1965 out of the Metropolitan Boroughs of Southwark, Camberwell and Bermondsey.

The borough is home to London Bridge station, the Shard, Tate Modern, Shakespeare's Globe Theatre and Borough Market. Dulwich Picture Gallery and the Imperial War Museum are also within the borough of Southwark."

area.name: City
area.overview:
"The London Borough of Hackney is in north-east London, and is the fastest growing borough in east London.

Much of Hackney maintains its inner-city character. However, this is changing, for example large housing estates in Dalston now sit side-by-side with gated communities.

The historical and administrative heart of Hackney is the area known as Hackney Central. To the east is the large open space of Hackney Marshes and to the south is Victoria Park. Light industries in the area around the River Lea employ over 3,000 people."
area.stats:
"1260

area.name: City
area.overview:
"The London Borough of Lambeth is a long, thin borough, about 3 miles wide and 7 miles long. Brixton is its civic centre.

Lambeth is home to many diverse communities. It includes the popular cultural hub of the South Bank, the bustling street markets of Brixton, the open spaces of Clapham and Streatham Commons and the exciting regeneration of Vauxhall. The borough is rich in history and is very well connected, close to central London and the City."
area.stats:
"1410

323k

in 2015

area.name: Docklands
area.overview:
"The London Borough of Newham was formed from the former Essex county boroughs of West Ham and East Ham. It is in the heart of east London and is one of the most diverse places in the country, with more than 200 dialects spoken.

Newham was one of the six host boroughs for the 2012 Summer Olympics and contains most of the Olympic Park, including the Olympic Stadium. The borough is also home to London City Airport, The Siemens Crystal, Westfield Stratford City and the Excel Exhibition Centre.

The borough is undergoing a rapid transformation with some of the largest regeneration schemes in the country. These include the revitalisation of the Royals Docks and the International Quarter in Stratford."
area.stats:
"2050
NEW HOMES

218m
PASSENGERS

area.name: West-End
area.overview:
"The London Borough of Wandsworth is situated in the south-west of London.

Wandsworth is home to Clapham Junction railway station, the country’s busiest station. The borough also features some of London’s most well-known open spaces, including Wimbledon Common, Battersea Park and Wandsworth Common.

The London Heliport, London's main and busiest heliport, is also situated in Wandsworth borough just beyond Battersea Park."

"1080

area.name: West-End
area.overview:
"The City of Westminster occupies much of the central area of Greater London.

Many of London’s most renowned sites are situated in the borough, including St James’s Palace, Buckingham Place, the Houses of Parliament and 10 Downing Street.

It is also home to the West End, London’s most famous shopping area. Streets within the borough include Oxford Street, Regent Street, Piccadilly and Bond Street."

area.name: West-End
area.overview:
"The borough of Kensington and Chelsea is located in the inner-west of London. As the smallest borough in London and the second smallest district in England, this urban area is one of the most densely populated in the United Kingdom.

It contains major museums and universities in Albertopolis, department stores such as Harrods, Peter Jones and Harvey Nichols, and embassies in Belgravia, Knightsbridge and Kensington Gardens. Each year it hosts the Notting Hill Carnival, Europe's largest carnival."

area.name: West-End
area.overview:
"The London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham is in West London, and forms part of Inner London.

In 1908, the Franco-British Exhibition and Olympic Games were hosted in the borough, at White City, but the site then took many decades to be redeveloped. In 1960, the BBC opened the BBC Television Centre, and in 2008, Westfield London, a large development with new transport links and a shopping centre, finally completed the redevelopment after one hundred years.

Many international corporations now have offices in the borough."
area.stats:
"1360
NEW HOMES
built in Hammersmith and Fulham between April 2014 and March 2015

182k
TOTAL POPULATION
in 2015

12850
BUSINESSES
active in Hammersmith and Fulham in 2013

131m
PASSENGERS
at Hammersmith's railway stations between April 2013 and March 2014"

area.overview:
"The City of Westminster occupies much of the central area of Greater London.

Many of London’s most renowned sites are situated in the borough, including St James’s Palace, Buckingham Place, the Houses of Parliament and 10 Downing Street.

It is also home to the West End, London’s most famous shopping area. Streets within the borough include Oxford Street, Regent Street, Piccadilly and Bond Street."
area.stats:
"750
NEW HOMES
built in Westminster between April 2014 and March 2015

236k

in 2015

area.name: West-End
area.overview:
"The London Borough of Lambeth is a long, thin borough, about 3 miles wide and 7 miles long. Brixton is its civic centre.

Lambeth is home to many diverse communities. It includes the popular cultural hub of the South Bank, the bustling street markets of Brixton, the open spaces of Clapham and Streatham Commons and the exciting regeneration of Vauxhall. The borough is rich in history and is very well connected, close to central London and the City."
area.stats:
"1410
NEW HOMES
built in Lambeth between April 2014 and March 2015

323k

in 2015

active in Lambeth in 2013

333m
PASSENGERS
at Lambeth's railway stations between April 2013 and March 2014"
